page.title: 18FARMING IN COUNTESTHORPE
page.content: In Countesthorpe,30 years ago there were 7 farms and 2 small holdings,but now in 1985 there are 2 main farms and one small holding. There are not a lot of farms in Countesthorpe or Blaby because of the council and housing estates. The two farms in Countesthorpe are called 'The Dolbys'and 'The Clarks'. The Dolbys produce corn and mutton and the Clarks produce dairy products. A farmer has to put in a lot of hard work even though he has special equipment eg: combine harvester. Most people have inherited their farms though some have recently bought them. The soil in Countesthorpe has a lack of nutrients so manure is spread across the land before it is put to use.
